answers.answer: Hi there. This appears like peripheral neuropathy and check for causes like alcoholism, vitamin deficiencies like B12, hypothyroidism, diabetes mellitus, lumbar spine herniation, spinal tumor etc. in guilain barre syndrome occurs after an acute infectious procedure. Guillain Barre Syndrome initially affects the peripheral nervous system. Normally it is acute form of paralysis in lower body area that moves towards upper limb and face. Gradually one loses all his reflexes and goes through a complete body paralysis. Guillain Barre Syndrome is a life threatening disorder and needs timely treatment and supportive care with intravenous immunoglobulins or plasmapheresis. Guillain Barre Syndrome is type of auto-immune disorder by low hypersensitivity reaction. Nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, stomach pain, migraines, low-grade fevers and chills are quite apparent symptoms of GBS. consult a neurologist for a clinical evaluation, blood tests to aid in diagnosis and the needful treatment. Take care.

question: im really worried i had my flu jab 5 days ago an few hours after got pins and needles in my toes n fingers the next day calf muscles felt sore after few days got bit better until i walked far then it started aching again but now pins and needles have returned im worried i have gbs please help
title: pins and needles
